datalog module¶

class datalog.Condition¶

Bases: abc.ABC

parent class to start and stop datalogger

Call check function with datapoint list, returns true if condition check passes

abstract check(datapoints)¶

Return true if check passes, false otherwise

abstract reset()¶

Resets the Condition

class datalog.CountCondition(count)¶

Bases: datalog.Condition

Condtion will return true when the number of datapoints reaches count

check(datapoints)¶

Adds 1 to the data count and returns true if it equals count condition

reset()¶

Resets the Condition

class datalog.DataLogMode(value)¶

Bases: enum.Enum

An enumeration.

Continuous = 3¶
Count = 2¶
Once = 1¶
class datalog.DataLogger(filename, start_condition=None, end_condition=None, start_at_zero=True, mode=None)¶

Bases: object

Writes datapoints to file

Parameters

  • filename (String) – Name of file to write to, relative or absolute path

  • start_condition (Condition) – Indicates when to start logging. If None, will be started straight away

  • end_condition (Condition) – Indicates when to end logging. If None, will be end only when stop is called

  • start_at_zero – If true, records log from t=0

put(datapoints)¶

External function for placing lists of datapoints on queue

Will put datapoints on queue if the logger is active

start()¶

Starts logging data that is fed to it, or waits for trigger

Starts running the write to file thread, which will place data in file or wait until trigger to do so

stop(flush=False)¶

Stop logging data, flush = false could lose some data in queue

class datalog.DataLoggerGroup(filename)¶

Bases: datalog.DataLogger

Extends functionality of a datalogger to many loggers

Used for testing, where switching to a new file can be automated based on a condition in a signal. Redcued overhead compared to have a list of dataloggers, as the datapoints only go where required. Also should be easier to setup

NEEDS IMPLEMENTING

class datalog.Datapoint(name=None, value=0, time=0, timestamp=0, index=0)¶

Bases: object

class datalog.TimeCondition(time)¶

Bases: datalog.Condition

Check returns true after datapoint time has passed

check(datapoints)¶

Checks elasped data time between start and now

reset()¶

Resets the Condition

class datalog.Trigger(value)¶

Bases: enum.Enum

An enumeration.

Either = 3¶
Equal = 4¶
Falling = 2¶
Rising = 1¶
class datalog.TriggerCondition(trigger, signal_name=None, value=0)¶

Bases: datalog.Condition

Specifiy a rising, falling, changing edge trigger on 0 or value

Used to start or end datalogger

Parameters

  • edge (Edge) – Rising, Falling, Either

  • value (Float, optional) – Value to check edge on, Default is 0

  • signal_name (String, optional) – Name of signal to check edge, defaults to first signal

check(datapoints)¶

Checks for signal edge given the new set of datapoints

Parameters

datapoints (data.Datapoint) –

reset()¶

Resets the Condition
